alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Iron (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 7:24PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dry wash and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Utah, including the following counties, Garfield and Iron. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 720 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause dry wash and small stream flooding. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Panguith Creek through its convergence with the Sevier River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Water may cross a portion of US-89 at the intersection with Panguitch Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Western Garfield and Eastern Iron Counties
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
